• About this track: This song tells us the story of a deserted futuristic world and couple in search of water. The legend of the water crystal lives on, one of a crystal "capable of giving life back to rivers, ocean, and the planet". artist.en: YOKAI feat. 鈴葉ユミ & Justin Thornburgh

• Used VSTs & Samples: Pianoteq, RA, EZBass, EZDrummer 3, HalionOne, Orchestral, Massive, Monologue, MiniDizi, Groove Agent One

• About this track: In Japan, the willow has a rather horrific connotation and is present in a lot of horror stories. In Europe, its meaning is significantly more romantic and poetic. In this song, the willow is a safe haven and its antlers bathing in water invite us to appreciate the moment.

06.title: Kajimakura
description: • Used VSTs & Samples: Pianoteq, RA, Church Organ, Groove Agent One, Tb_Peach, Orchestral

• About this track: This song is directly inspired by a japanese poem of the Edo era. In it, we follow the journey of a lover gone offshore on a river boat. The oar of the boat being their only bed, they yearn with regret of their own love and drown in sorrow.

08.title: The Healing Power of Water
description: • Used VSTs & Samples: Padshop, Halion Sonic SE, Groove Agent SE, Silk, R

• About this track: The rhythm was produced with a J-Play which isn't even produced anymore. The song sounds quite dark, but it also make you feel like you're underwater. Imagine sinking in an ocean without knowing what's below you. You can imagine creatures swimming in the depths. The ambience is very much like a futuristic city similar to New Port City from Ghost in the Shell, with a cyberpunk tonality which brings a touch of romanticism and darkness to the song.

09.title: TwinSan
description: • Used VSTs & Samples: EZDrummer 3, EZBass, Pianoteq, Opus Voice of Passion, Halion Sonic SE

• About this track: This song has a bunch of references to the game Little Big Adventure, as well as Yuki Kajiura's work. I chose this album to close off the album (remix aside), since it's quite dense and epic sounding, and sounds like a good lead for another album. Considering its games and anime inspirations like Sword Art Online, I thought it'd be interesting to end on an instrumental longer track than the rest of the album, similarly to how progressive rock bands do.
Genre: Progressive Rock, Video Game Music
